guide.conclusion: The best design that pushes the boundaries of Objet PolyJet 3D Printing wins AUD$1,000 and a AUD$2,000 prototyping voucher, as well as their model printed and delivered by Formero.

flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction:
Challenge

Formero is looking for the most creative and innovative use of Objet 3D Printing technology. Design concepts for “Images Come To Life" competition can be anything you like, such as a light shade, original piece of furniture, product part or assembly that enhances an existing product, toy concept or an accessory (i.e. phone cover, fashion item, pen holder, business card holder...).

The competition is open to anyone with 3D CAD modelling capabilities - designers, engineers, animators or students worldwide.

Designs must fit within a size requirement of 250x250x250mm and must be supplied as a 3D STL CAD file (see website for details). We encourage entrants to explore the Objet 3D Printing possibilities and incorporate a mix of materials listed within the Objet description.

What is Objet 3D Printing Technology?

Objet's PolyJet™ technology works by jetting photopolymer materials onto a build tray layer-by-layer until the part is complete. Utilising Objet Connex™ 3D printing, entrants to the competition have the chance to print models in a variety of soft and hard plastics, or combination of both materials in one part, to create superior detailed and accurate models, giving endless creativity.

Deadline: 7th November 2011

To learn more and download entry form visit:

http://www.formero.com.au/3D_Printing_Co...

guide.summary: Nothing beats seeing your designs come to life, that's why we are on a quest to find the most creative and innovative model that pushes the boundaries of 3D Printing, using Objet 3D Printing technology.
guide.title: When Images Come To Life - 3D Printing Competition
